entityId.localType: State Library of South Australia Archival Number

nameEntry.part: Records of the Women's Australian National Services

biogHist.abstract: Records of the Women's Australian National Services (W.A.N.S.) are held by the State Library of South Australia and includes minutes, annual reports, photographs, members' roll, financial records, training manual, and newspaper cuttings relating to the Services and Wanslea Children's Home.
biogHist.p: Some of the records in this collection are unprocessed and access may not be possible. The State Library of South Australia will be able to provide further advice.
This collection includes records about the Women's Australian National Services (W.A.N.S.). The records sometimes refer to Wanslea Children' Home which was run by W.A.N.S.

list.item: General meeting minutes, 1941-1997 - Some minutes include Wanslea reports, matron's reports and House Committee reports. These reports provide information about numbers of children in the home, discussion of maintenance and staffing issues.
Ephemera, c. 1962 - Includes a flyer promtoing the services offered by Wanslea.
Bookings record, 1962-1964 - Records the work being done by W.A.N.S. staff, at Wanslea and in people's homes.
Women's Australian National Services: their next objective "Wanslea" booklet, undated.
Newspaper clippings, 1941-1985 - Includes scrapbooks which document the history of W.A.N.S. and Wanslea in the press.
Photographs, c.1943-1948 - Includes group photographs of W.A.N.S. and Wanslea staff.

descriptiveNote.p: Some records within the Records of Wanslea Children's Home collection were transferred from the Anglican Diocesan Archives to the State Library of South Australia in 2011 to become part of the Records of the Women's Australian National Services collection.
